result.execSummary:
The defendant Willard R Mahner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 20 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 10 jobs per month and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Huber allowed - the defendant may serve the sentence in Vilas County as long as arrangements have been made.
To be performed at no less than 16 hours each six months when released from incarceration.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Willard R Mahner in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Defendant Willard R Mahner in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:29 AM. Judge Habeck is appearing via video from Shawano County and does collauquey with the defendant to make sure it is OK that he appear via video as the defendant has a right for the Judge to appear in person. Mahner is OK with the Judge appearing via video. All parties have revocation paperwork with no inaccuracies or errors. State makes recommendation prior to sentencing - 9 months - concurrent to any jail time that the defendant is currently serving, Scholke makes recommendation prior to sentencing - concurs with the State for a 9 month jail sentence - concurrent to any sentence that the defendant is currently serving (will be released from that sentence in November of 2018). Mahner makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: will go along with the recommendations of the State and sentences the defendant to 9 months in FC jail - concurrent to any time he is currently serving - huber allowed - credit for 6 days, turn any unpaid fines into civil judgment, right to appeal, adjourned at 11:34 AM,
Sentence adjustment review on June 7, 2018 at 11:15 am.
Sentence adjustment review on June 5, 2018 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Willard R Mahner in court with attorney Anne M. Katte.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:58 PM. 15CF78 - plead NC to counts #1 and #2. State - has to be G plea. Katte and Mahner are OK with that. Court - plea questionnaire indicates a G plea to counts #1 and #2 as alleged on 15CF78. State - counts #3 and #4 are to be dismissed and read in. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru that, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty. Court dismisses counts #3 and #4. State - 16CF85 - only count would be dismissed and read in. Court dismisses and reads in 16CF85. State - part of the plea offer is joint in nature and part is free to argue - joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 3 years on each count, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: $500.00 fine plus costs and surcharges, free to argue conditional jail, other conditions include: AODA and follow thru, no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or class B establishments, 100 hours of community service, 180 days conditional jail, employment/school. Katte makes final argument prior to sentencing - agrees with the 3 years probation but argues for the conditional jail time, 110 days credit on 16CF85, asking for a very short jail term or an imposed and stayed jail term. Mahner makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #2 - count #1 - $500.00 fine plus costs - take bond posted, #2 - $100.00 fine plus costs - take bond posted, AODA and follwo thru, employment/school (20 hrs/10 jobs), submit DNA sample, 100 hours of community service - 16 hours each 6 months when released from jail, count #1 - 90 days of conditional jail - huber allowed, #2 - 90 days conditional jail - huber allowed - concurrent to count #1. Count #1 - impose and stay 1 year in jail, placed on probation for 3 years, report on or before Monday, 11/28/16 at 4:30 PM - can serve the sentence in Vilas County as long as all arrangements have been made, credit for 6 days on count #2 only, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal.
Final pre-trial on November 8, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Willard R Mahner in court with attorney Anne M. Katte.  Defendant Willard R Mahner in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:29 PM. Katte - have had discussions with State in regards to both cases. Court and State review cases. State proposes that these matters be set for FPT on 11/8/16 instructing the court that he does not believe a PH will be needed on 16CF85 for stated reasons. Katte agrees, has dicussed with the defendant his right to PH, new case could be set for either PH or FPT on 11/8/16, would be willing to execute a waiver of PH today. Court would prefer a waiver of PH today. Court - 16CF85 - does verbal waiver of PH with the defendant, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Katte willing to proceed to ARGN today even though there is not an Information filed yet, willing to enter NG pleas anticipating that the Information will mirror the complaint. State will be filing an Infomation today that mirrors the complaint. Katte enters NG pleas to all counts on 16CF85, asks that signtature bond be reinstated for both matters. Court does not understand why a signature bond on 15CF78 is needed. Court will reduce bond on 16CF85 to $3000 signature bond. State - bond - no objections to a signature bond. Court continues bond on 15CF78 and sets both matters for FPT on 11/8/16 at 2:00 PM.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 8, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on August 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Willard R Mahner in court with attorney Anne M. Katte.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:11 PM. State - resolved with one glitch that needs an additional 60 days for stated reasons. Court continues bond, sets matter for another PLEAS.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Anne M. Katte in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:02 PM. Katte updates court on the whereabouts of the defendant, but State has made new offer and defendant is willing to accept the matter but the defendant not here to take care of case, asking for an adjournment for PLEAS and no warrant. State has no objections to an adjournment at this point but reserves right to file a bail jumping on today's non-appearance if he does not appear at next date and time. Court will continue bond, sets for PLEAS.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Willard R Mahner in court with attorney Anne M. Katte.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 12:02 p.m. State has filed INFO which mirrors complaint. Katte has filed waiver for PH, waives further reading of INFO as it mirrors, proceed to ARGN and enters not guilty pleas. Court goes over wavier and finds defendant is freely, voluntarily and inteligently waiving his right to a preliminary hearing, binds over for trial. records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved
Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Willard R Mahner not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel Anne Katte appears via phone on behalf of the defendant. Called 11:08 a.m. Attorney Mary Burns makes statement - just received message called and his car broke down and is trying to find someone to bring him here. Court warrant $3000/body and bond posted forfeited. Will not do warrant until end of day and will call if he does appear. Katte agrees and will be available to call and court will quash warrant if he appears and give him another date. Recalled 1:57 pm. Willard Mahner now appears in person and with counsel Anne Katte who appears via phone. Defendant has copy of complaint. Court vacates warrant and sets aside forfeiture. Court advises of charges, penalties and rights. Counsel advises that will waive time limits. Court waives time limits. Bond continued. Preliminary Hearing - July 16, 2015 at 2:30 pm.

Defendant Willard R Mahner in court w/out counsel.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:42 am. Defendant handed complaint in court. Court advises of complaint, penalties, rights and rights to attorney. Defendant understands charges. Wants attorney has attorney in Vilas County and she is SPD appointed. Mahner indicates his girlfriend may get him private attorney. Court advises to contact SPD. Court warns on coming back without attorney. Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 10:30 am.
